title: That incredible-looking mod reimagining Fallout 1 in Doom is still alive, and there's a glorious new trailer
description: It's been five years since artist Alexander "Red888guns" Berezin's efforts to reimagine the grim world of Fallout as a 3D Doom-style shooter had us wondering what a more substantial version of their vision might look like. And finally we have an answer thanks to a newly shared, and stunningly atmospheric, Fallout: Bakersfield trailer. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Stop Killing Games says 'industry has filed false claims' against EU campaign as it surpasses 1.4m signatures
description: Stop Killing Games figurehead Ross Scott says "serious accusations" and "false claims" have been filed against the game preservation movement's European initiative, accusing the campaign of violating EU rules. All this comes as support continues to gain momentum, with the official EU petition having now surpassed 1.4m signatures. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Uzumaki Anime Limited Edition Steelbook Is Up For Preorder
description: Uzumaki Limited Edition Steelbook (Blu-ray) $35 | Releases September 9 Preorder at Walmart Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Gruv Uzumaki Standard Edition (Blu-ray) $20 | Releases September 9 Preorder at Walmart Preorder at Amazon For decades, Junji Ito has been considered the gold standard for horror manga. The Stephen King of the genre, the Japanese illustrator weaves terrifying tales with horrifically mesmerizing art, and the anime adaptation of his legendary Uzumaki series releases on Blu-ray September 9 in two different editions, including the Limited Edition Steelbook shown below.UzumakiPriced at $35, this edition of the anime comes in an eye-catching steelbook case that perfectly capture's Ito's art and the terrifying power of spirals. Uzumaki is also getting a standard edition Blu-ray for $20. Uzumaki Limited Edition Steelbook (Blu-ray) $35 | Releases September 9 The steelbook cover is hypnotic, and inside, you'll find portraits of the characters Shuichi Saito and Kirie Goshima inside.The anime adaptation isn't too long--it has a total runtime of 96 minutes across four episodes--but you are getting bonus materials like trailers, promotional videos, and an art gallery.As of July 21, Amazon hasn't started taking preorders, but there is a store page. Preorder at Walmart Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Gruv Uzumaki Standard Edition (Blu-ray) $20 | Releases September 9 The standard edition comes with a regular plastic case and a cardboard sleeve. It includes the same on-disc bonus content as the Limited Edition Steelbook.Amazon hasn't opened preorders just yet, but we expect it to be available soon. Preorder at Walmart Preorder at Amazon Junji Ito Manga - Deluxe Editions & Story Collections We rounded up 20-plus books for horror manga fans. See at Amazon Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Explore The Lore Final Fantasy 16's World In This New Book
description: Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI $39.80 (was $45) | Releases March 31, 2026 Preorder at Amazon Every mainline Final Fantasy game introduces its own lore and cast of characters to the franchise, and Final Fantasy XVI is no exception. Set in Valisthea, a world of magic, cruel gods, and powerful Eikons, Final Fantasy XVI features one of the most mature and gritty settings of the mainline series--but still offers the expansive worldbuilding and fantastical themes the series is known for, along with unique interpretations of Final Fantasy staples like Moogles, Chocobos, crystals, and more. If you want to learn more about Valisthea, you can revisit Final Fantasy XVI's setting with the upcoming Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI. As the title implies, this hardcover book will offer a deeper look at Final Fantasy XVI's many kingdoms, factions, and characters when it launches on March 31, 2026. Preorders are discounted to $39.80 (normally $45) at Amazon. Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI $39.80 (was $45) | Releases March 31, 2026 Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI is a massive 368-page hardcover book, explores everything from history to geography, music to cooking, and much more. Rather than simply being an encyclopedia cataloging the world of Valisthea, the book is written from the perspective of Valisthean scholar Harpocrates II Hyperboreos--a character you'll encounter frequently in Final Fantasy XVI--with numerous in-world journal entries, letters, and character conversations presented in illustrated full-color pages. Many of the entries are even penned by Final Fantasy XVI voice actors Ben Starr (Clive), Stewart Clarke (Dion), and Christopher York (Gav). Preorder at Amazon If you're looking to build your own Final Fantasy library, you can pair Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI with the The Art of Final Fantasy XVI. Published last year, the massive hardcover art book offers hundreds of pages of concept art, illustrations, and behind-the-scenes development materials for the game. The book is currently on sale for just $22, a nice 45% discount compared to its normal $40 price. There's also the Final Fantasy XVI Poster Art Collection book, which collects 33 posters featuring illustrations from the games, including pieces of the main characters, the Eikon summons, and more. Normally $35, it's on sale for $20.44.Of course, the best way to experience Final Fantasy XVI's world first-hand is with the games itself. If you're on PS5, you can grab it for $24.88 (was $40) at Amazon, while PC players can get it for $50 on GMG. While this gets you the base game--which will take you through the main story featuring Clive's struggle to free the world of Valisthea from the control of the giant, magical Mothercrystals--Final Fantasy XVI has also received two paid DLC expansions, Echoes of the Fallen and The Rising Tide, that add additional side stories that flesh out the world with new characters, dungeons, side-quests, and unlockable abilities for Clive to master. These are available as separate purchases on PS5 via the PlayStation Store, while PC players can purchase the $70 Complete Edition, which includes the base game, both DLC chapters, and a few extra in-game items.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 886
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. What time of the day are you at your best? From 5:30 until about 11 in the morning. Everything is downhill after lunch, which is when I turn into Sleepy Spice, hahaha! I don’t know when it happened, but somewhere along the way in the last 10 years, I became a morning person. 2. Things you like in your smoothie? Greek yogurt, vanilla protein powder, raspberries (for fiber!) are my favorites. I also like bananas or apples for sweetness. 3. Something about your current makeup routine that bugs you? Ugh, the concealer I’ve been using from MAC just doesn’t seal well after I use it. Bits and bobs of it end up all over the place. It’s super messy and it bothers me. 4. Something about your[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 886 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 866
description: Rosie should have known better than to trust Marnie with Rosie’s investments. After all, Marnie doesn’t have any background or credentials or expertise in financial planning. There was no reason to think Marnie would be able to manage Rosie’s assets, but Rosie wanted to give her a chance. Oh, well. Bad move on Rosie’s part. Even someone of Rosie’s intellectual stature screws up sometimes. Sure, she may understand quantum physics better than any other cat on the planet, but that doesn’t mean she understands compound interest. Sigh… Now Rosie has to think of a way of to recoup all those losses. Hmm… What could she invent? I’m sure she’ll think of something. 🐱 Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 866 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Ubisoft CEO responds to Stop Killing Games, and casually mentions a new Ghost Recon game's coming
description: Ubisoft boss Yves Guillemot has responded to a shareholder question about the Stop Killing Games campaign - and in a very newsworthy corporate question and answer session, revealed that a new Ghost Recon game's in the works. To quickly recap, Stop Killing Games aim to stop publishers rendering online games unplayable after the cessation of official support. They were inspired to take action by Ubisoft themselves 'sunsetting' online racer The Crew. Ubisoft's response to their campaign comes around the time the group's petition to the EU to take action against the mass extinction of online games hits 1.4 million signatures. Despite some doubts about potential signature spoofing, the petition's recently attracted support from EU politicians and industry trade bodies, so it's no surprise Guillemot's fielding questions about it from moneyfolk. Read more
author: Mark Warren
